snippet: With Black Friday starting on Thanksgiving, and Cyber Monday lasting a week, retailers are doing their best to encourage a holiday shopping binge. But the economic effect is unclear.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column points out that with Black Friday starting on Thanksgiving, and Cyber Monday lasting a week, retailers are doing their best to encourage a holiday shopping binge; holds, however, the economic effect is unclear; notes overall sales at 16 retailers rose only 1.6 percent in November.
lead_paragraph: With Black Friday starting on Thanksgiving, and Cyber Monday lasting a week, retailers are doing their best to encourage a holiday shopping binge. But the economic effect is unclear.

headline.print_headline: A Stampede? Undoubtedly. An Economic Jolt? Maybe Not.
headline.seo: A Holiday Shopping Stampede, but Maybe No Economic Jolt
headline.main: A Shopping Stampede, Yes, but Maybe No Economic Jolt
